instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 liquid damage spill with keyboard issue
threads.message:
Hi guys,
I have <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with liquid damage, cleaned and working.. if I shutdown the laptop keyboard not recognized.. if I restart the machine then it works.. keyboard, trackpad and cable was replaced ..advise please?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 liquid damage spill with keyboard issue
threads.message: No idea what you exactly mean. Does it not power on with the power button?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 liquid damage spill with keyboard issue
threads.message: it does work fine, if i restart the computer then it shows a message asking to connect wireless keyboard(internal keyboard is not detected) but if i shut it down completely the turn on keyboard works....it is 2015

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 liquid damage spill with keyboard issue
threads.message: Tried known good trackpad and cable?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 liquid damage spill with keyboard issue
threads.message: 99% of the time it's the shit trackpad cable.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 liquid damage spill with keyboard issue
threads.message: keyboard, trackpad and cable all replaced

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 liquid damage spill with keyboard issue
threads.message: Check corrosion around connector area, <CHIP>U4820</CHIP>/30 area

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 liquid damage spill with keyboard issue
threads.message: When you say the utrn on keyboard works are you implying that only the power button works? If that is the case, my bet is ffsomeone ripped the inductor for <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> off the board with their fingernail. I get three of these a week. L4803?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015 liquid damage spill with keyboard issue
threads.message:
no just the power button, the whole keyboard works fine........then after restarting the computer the problem occur, so if i remove the battery and starts the computer it works fine till i restart it . i will Check corrosion around connector area, <CHIP>U4820</CHIP>/30 area and report back
Thanks
